revised_title: Biosynthesis of Sterols and Related Compounds: Mechanisms of Substrate Activation in Pyridine Nucleotide-Linked Reactions
tldr: The authors discuss the biosynthesis of sterols and related compounds, focusing on substrate activation in pyridine nucleotide-linked reactions. They summarize their findings on the reduction of steroid double bonds, including the 7(8), 14(15), and 24(25) bonds, and propose a general mechanism for the pyridine nucleotide-dependent reduction of polar and non-polar unsaturated linkages.
